CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper April 21, 1945, pg. 15, reads: "Gets $100 Bond - Winner of the first prize in the High School Essay Contest sponsored by The Pittsburgh Courier, Miss Eunice Talbot receives a $100 war bond from the Rev. Charles H. Foggie, one of the judges, while Ira F. Lewis, Courier president, looks on. Miss Talbot, a student at Peabody High School, has already decided she wants to be a writer, for it seems to be a profitable business. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Rev. Charles Foggie presenting one hundred dollar U.S. savings bond to Eunice Talbot for first prize in Pittsburgh Courier's High School Essay Contest, with Courier president Ira Lewis, standing on right
